sections.title: Map Your Next Money Milestones
sections.subtitle: Translate dreams into measurable financial goals with clear timelines

sections.title: What You'll Do
items: Identify goals across short, mid, and long-term horizons
Calculate realistic price tags and due dates
Prioritize based on urgency and impact
Build a monthly contribution plan to stay on track

sections.title: From Wish to Plan
sections.content: Goals become actionable when they are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound (SMART). This exercise helps you define each element so you always know what to do next—and what to celebrate along the way.

points.title: Specific
points.description: Name the exact outcome—'Pay off $3,000 credit card' beats 'Get out of debt'.

points.title: Measurable
points.description: Assign numbers so progress is trackable (amount saved, balance left, target date).

points.title: Achievable
points.description: Ensure the payment or savings schedule fits your cash flow after essentials.

points.title: Relevant
points.description: Confirm the goal advances a life priority, not just an impulse.

points.title: Time-bound
points.description: Commit to a deadline so you can back into monthly milestones.

sections.title: Goal Balancing Rule
sections.content: Have at least one stability goal (safety), one growth goal (future), and one joy goal (quality of life).

sections.title: Funding the Goals
sections.content: For each goal, divide the total cost by the number of months until your deadline. This gives you a target monthly contribution. Align contributions with payday and automate wherever possible to remove friction.

sections.title: Goal Design Workshop
steps: Brainstorm 3–5 goals and categorize them as short-term (<12 months), mid-term (1–3 years), or long-term (3+ years).
Estimate the total amount required for each goal using real numbers (quotes, research, calculators).
Decide on a target completion date and compute the monthly contribution needed.
Rank the goals by importance and energy—select the top two to fully fund first.
Document your plan in a tracker or spreadsheet and set an automated reminder to review monthly.

sections.title: Visual Tracking
sections.content: Use a shared dashboard or habit tracker that shows contributions filling up a progress bar—seeing momentum keeps motivation high.
